data.name: Human History Museum
data.description: Indoor exhibits focus in the human history of Zion National Park. A 22-minute orientation film highlights the dramatic landscapes of the park and examines the history of the canyon. Rotating art exhibits feature regional artists. Visit the bookstore for maps, book, and gifts. There are dramatic views of the Towers of the Virgin and Bridge Mountain outside.
data.audioDescription: Located 1 mile from the South Entrance. Reserved parking spaces are available with a ramp leading to the building.

passportStampImages.altText: A typical passport stamp laying on a paper with several circular brown stamps
passportStampImages.title: Human History Museum Passport Stamp

operatingHours.description: Open daily from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. The Zion Canyon Shuttle only stops here going toward the Zion Canyon Visitor Center (down canyon). Shuttles to the Temple of Sinawava (up canyon) do not stop here.
operatingHours.name: Human History Museum

data.name: Kolob Canyons Visitor Center
data.description: Closed daily from 12pm-1pm This is the entry point to the Kolob Canyons area of the park. It is located 45 miles north of Springdale and 17 miles south of Cedar City at Exit 40 on Interstate 15. Park rangers are available to answer questions. Exhibits explore the geology, vegetation, and wildlife of this unique landscape.
data.audioDescription: The Kolob Canyons Visitor Center is located 45 miles north of Springdale and 17 miles south of Cedar City at Exit 40 on Interstate 15. Reserved parking spaces are available with accessible walkways leading to the building. Accessible unisex restroom, sales displays, water bottle filling station, and information desk.

passportStampImages.altText: A brown circular passport stamp on a page
passportStampImages.title: Kolob Canyons Passport Stamp

passportStampImages.altText: Badge shaped stamp on paper with text "Junior Ranger. Kolob Canyons. Zion National Park"
passportStampImages.title: Kolob Canyons - Zion Nat. Park Jr Ranger

passportStampImages.altText: The letter Z bisected by an infinity sign
passportStampImages.title: Zion Forever Logo Stamp

data.directionsInfo: This is the entry point to the Kolob Canyons area of the park. It is located 45 miles north of Springdale and 17 miles south of Cedar City at Exit 40 on Interstate 15.

operatingHours.description:
All guests are required to stop at the Kolob Canyons Visitor Center to show an Interagency Park Pass or pay the Zion National Park entrance fee. There is also a bookstore operated by the Zion Natl Park Forever Project. Closed daily from 12 p.m. - 1 p.m. for lunch.

Wilderness permits cannot be picked up here. Please go to the Zion Canyon Visitor Center for all Wilderness permits.
operatingHours.name: Kolob Canyons Visitor Center

images.title: Kolob Canyons Entrance Sign
images.altText: A stone monument with a wooden sign the says Kolob Canyons - Zion National Park
images.caption: The Kolob Canyons Entrance Monument is near the visitor center.

data.name: Zion Canyon Visitor Center
data.description: Located near the South Entrance of the park, the Zion Canyon Visitor Center is an excellent place to begin your exploration of Zion Canyon. Park rangers and outdoor exhibits will help you plan your visit and make the most of your time. Inquire at the Zion Canyon Wilderness Desk about permits for backpacking, canyoneering, and other trips into the wilderness. Visit the bookstore for maps, books, and gifts.
data.audioDescription: Located 0.2 miles from the South Entrance. Reserved parking spaces are available with accessible walkways leading to the building. Accessible unisex restroom, sales displays, water fountain, water bottle filling station, and information desk.
data.passportStampLocationDescription: Located in the Zion Forever Project Bookstore at the Zion Canyon Visitor Center.

passportStampImages.altText: Passport Stamp Station in Zion Bookstore
passportStampImages.title: Passport Stamp Station in Zion Bookstore

emailAddresses.description: All your park questions, including Visitor Center information can be answered at this address.

data.directionsInfo: By Car Zion National Park is located on State Route 9 in Springdale, Utah. All mileages below represent the distance from the Zion Canyon Visitor Center. From Las Vegas, Nevada (163 miles), Mesquite, Nevada (80 miles), and Saint George, Utah (40 miles): Interstate 15 North Exit 16 - Right on State Route 9 East (33 miles) Right to stay on State Route 9 East in La Verkin, Utah (20 miles) Stay on State Route 9 East into Zion National Park, the Zion Canyon Visitor Center is ahead on the right.

operatingHours.description: The Zion Canyon Visitor Center is open every day of the year, with longer hours from May through September.
operatingHours.name: Zion Canyon Visitor Center
